content:
It is always recommended that you seek guidance from a healthcare professional before attempting any new exercise program, especially if you have a pre-existing injury. They can provide tailored recommendations based on your specific injury and advise what stretches and exercises are safe for you to do.

By doing stretches or exercises that are not appropriate for your injury, you risk further injuring yourself or lengthening the recovery time. Additionally, certain stretches or exercises that may be effective for some people may not be suitable for others based on differing health conditions, body types, or injury severity.

It is important to prioritize your safety and health by seeking professional guidance and advice before attempting any exercise or stretching program with a pre-existing injury. It may save you time and money in the long run by avoiding further injury or setbacks.
